page.title: 11The Cobbled Street Of Dent.
page.content: The original main street was probably laid before the Norman Church was built,it is mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086.Dent was a big market town where people came to trade their wares such as livestock of all kinds, wool,knitting,food produce etc.The Main Street was always a hive of activity with knitters sitting busily knitting in the "knitting galleries" which have been taken down to make room for milk container vehicles, tractors and the like.George Fox,the founder of The Society Of Friends, preached at the market cross, which has also gone now.There are still remains of the horse troughs and the horse mounts on the cobbled street. The houses lining the streets are all stone built and about three or four hundred years old.The actual cobbles are the original ones.
